Exams.Name: PA Chest
Patient Position: Hands on hips and out of the way
CR: Center CR to T7 (at level of inferior angle of scapula)

Evaluation Criteria.Anatomy Demonstrated: Entirety of both lungs from apices to costrophrenic angles. Trachea from T1 and lower. Hilum, heart, great vessels, and bony thorax.
Evaluation Criteria.Position: Chin elevated, arms out of way, scapulae out of lungs, no rotation, equal collimation on both lateral sides. T7 is centered and 10 posterior ribs visible above diaphragm.
Evaluation Criteria.Exposure: No motion and sufficient long-scale contrast for fine vascular markings.

Exams.Name: LAT Chest
Exams.Patient Position: Patient erect, left side of chest touching IR, arms raised above head, chin up.
Exams.Part Position: Positioned in a true lateral. Coronal plane in center of IR. Ensure no rotation of thorax.
Exams.CR: No angle. Center CR to T7 (at level of inferior angle of scapula).

Evaluation Criteria.Anatomy Demonstrated: Entirety of both lungs from apices to costrophrenic angles. Anterior sternum to posterior ribs.
Evaluation Criteria.Position: Chin elevated, arms out of way, no rotation, equal collimation on both anterior and posterior sides. T7 is centered.
Evaluation Criteria.Exposure: No motion and sufficient long-scale contrast for visualization of rib outlines and lung markings through the heart shadow and upper lung areas.

Exams.Name: PA Hand

Technical Factors.IR Orientation: Landscape or portrait, depending on patient habitus.

Exams.Patient Position: Patient erect, anterior chest touching IR, hands on hips and out of the way. Chin up, shoulders rotated forward to clear the scapulae from the apices.
Exams.Part Position: Allow 1 1/2 inches of IR above the shoulders. Ensure no rotation of thorax.
Exams.CR: No angle. Center CR to T7 (at level of inferior angle of scapula).

Evaluation Criteria.Anatomy Demonstrated: Entirety of both lungs from apices to costrophrenic angles. Trachea from T1 and lower. Hilum, heart, great vessels, and bony thorax.
Evaluation Criteria.Position: Chin elevated, arms out of way, scapulae out of lungs, no rotation, equal collimation on both lateral sides. T7 is centered and 10 posterior ribs visible above diaphragm.
Evaluation Criteria.Exposure: No motion and sufficient long-scale contrast for fine vascular markings.

Exams.Name: OBL Hand

Exams.CR: No angle. Center CR to T7 (at level of inferior angle of scapula).

Evaluation Criteria.Anatomy Demonstrated: Entirety of both lungs from apices to costrophrenic angles. Trachea from T1 and lower. Hilum, heart, great vessels, and bony thorax.
Evaluation Criteria.Position: Chin elevated, arms out of way, scapulae out of lungs, no rotation, equal collimation on both lateral sides. T7 is centered and 10 posterior ribs visible above diaphragm.
Evaluation Criteria.Exposure: No motion and sufficient long-scale contrast for fine vascular markings.
